==Use==
==Use==
===SYSLINUX and ISOLINUX===
===SYSLINUX and ISOLINUX===
â
SYSLINUX is not normally used for booting full Linux installations since Linux is not normally installed on FAT filesystems. Instead, it is often used for boot or rescue floppy discs, [[Live USB]]s, or other lightweight boot systems. ISOLINUX is generally used by Linux [[LiveCD]] and bootable install CDs.
+
SYSLINUX is not normally used for booting full Linux installations since Linux is not normally installed on FAT filesystems. Instead, it is often used for boot or rescue floppy discs, [[Live USB]]s, or other lightweight boot systems. ISOLINUX is generally used by Linux [[Live CD]] and bootable install CDs.
A minor complication is involved when booting from CD-ROM. The [[El Torito (CD-ROM standard)|El Torito standard]] allows for booting in two different modes;
A minor complication is involved when booting from CD-ROM. The [[El Torito (CD-ROM standard)|El Torito standard]] allows for booting in two different modes;
